Articles.Content:
Any help in this? I have gfx settings to low, and my 180 part ship on my laptop if giving 5 fps.

Suggestions?

Often graphics is not the limiting factor. KSP is very heavy on physics calculations and until unity 5 is limited to a single thread. It's much more likely your hitting the limits on your CPU than GPU.
APU rather, it's some generic AMD thingy. A8 or whatever.
Try turning up the "Max Physics Delta" slider in the settings, this will trade some simulation accuracy for better performance.

Is this on the pad/runway or in orbit?

The ground is a lag monster for a lot of rigs. The very first thing I do when my craft loads is look straight up, I tend to fly the entire ascent from below. The same applies to low orbit often, you can pick up a decent chunk of fps by rotating the view so the planet is behind the camera.

No idea why your particular setup is causing such problems, but if you already axed gfx then thats the only trick I have left in my book.

There's a lot of PQS terrain stuff going on while still in Kerbins atmosphere, it'd be interesting to compare the RAM speeds of those suffering with lag to those with smooth frame rates.

A lot of store bought PC's come with bottom of the range RAM, even if they have a lot of it, programs won't use more RAM than they need so it just becomes a sales point to bundle lots of cheap memory.

Is this on the pad/runway or in orbit?

The ground is a lag monster for a lot of rigs. The very first thing I do when my craft loads is look straight up, I tend to fly the entire ascent from below. The same applies to low orbit often, you can pick up a decent chunk of fps by rotating the view so the planet is behind the camera.

No idea why your particular setup is causing such problems, but if you already axed gfx then thats the only trick I have left in my book.

It's in orbit. I'm also using EVE PlanetShine and DistantObjects, but none off those are visible from KerbinSuperSuperHighOrbit

Define "lag" - generally that's a term for network issues ( including things like USB ) where there's an actual delay. Are you getting delayed response to keyboard input?

If it's just bad FPS and the clock turning yellow ( which is definitely not lag ), that will usually be CPU limitations and you can possibly help at least get nearer realtime by messing with the physics minimum frame length slider in options.

Edited October 25, 2015 by Van Disaster

AMD's A8 mobile APUs have pretty bad cpu performance. Plus, the integrated graphics are bad for any processor out there. Also, It's generally laggy for everyone when you have ships over/near 200 parts. KSP is definitely hitting the limits of your APU. I have an Intel Sandy Bridge mobile processor with Intel HD graphics in my laptop, and I think it performs worse than your Laptop, so you're not alone

Is this on the pad/runway or in orbit?

The ground is a lag monster for a lot of rigs. The very first thing I do when my craft loads is look straight up, I tend to fly the entire ascent from below. The same applies to low orbit often, you can pick up a decent chunk of fps by rotating the view so the planet is behind the camera.

^^This...I also do this and found it helps fps..
Uninstall your mods, or get a real computer. Craptops can't handle modded KSP very well.
